meanings.definition: A large, tall bird with a long neck and legs.
meanings.sent1: The cranes flew gracefully over the lake.
meanings.sent2: I saw a family of cranes by the river.
meanings.sent3: The cranes in the zoo were showing off their elegant necks.
meanings.sent4: The cranes stood tall like statues in the wetlands.
meanings.sent5: The majestic cranes danced in the sky with their long legs trailing behind.

meanings.definition: A machine used for lifting and moving heavy objects.
meanings.sent1: The construction site used cranes to lift steel beams.
meanings.sent2: The cranes at the port were loading cargo onto the ships.
meanings.sent3: The cranes in the factory worked tirelessly all day long.
meanings.sent4: The cranes moved with precision, like giant metal arms reaching out.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the cranes echoed through the warehouse as they hoisted crates into place.

meanings.definition: To stretch out one's neck in order to see better.
meanings.sent1: I cranes my neck to get a better view of the stage.
meanings.sent2: She cranes her neck to see the parade passing by.
meanings.sent3: The curious child cranes his neck to peek over the fence.
meanings.sent4: The audience cranes their necks to catch a glimpse of the celebrity.
meanings.sent5: He cranes his neck forward, eager to see what's happening in the distance.
